roleset.name: auction

role.descr: how much you're bidding, buying price

example.name: just bidder and goods
example.text: Ford will bid for 100% of Jaguar's shares

example.name: with price
example.text: Mr. Pilson bid $243 million for rights to the 1992 Winter Games.
example.arg: for rights to the 1992 Winter Games.

example.name: With Purpose clause
example.text: Paribas will bid to boost its stake in Navigation Mixte
example.arg: to boost its stake in Navigation Mixte

example.name: goods as infinitive
example.text: Garth Drabinsky will bid $780.6 million to acquire the company.

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: New England Electric System bowed out of the bidding for PublicService Co. of New Hampshire , saying that the risks were toohigh and the potential payoff too far in the future to justify ahigher offer .
example.arg: for Public Service Co. of New Hampshire

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: His bidding on that house resulted on higher counteroffers by several other parties.

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: Multimillion-dollar bidding on the Jenkins Venus sculpture last year was reminiscent of the erstwhile tech IPO binge

example.name: NP only, args 0, 1, & 2.
example.text: its previously reported $ 27.50-a-share bid to buy the company

example.name: NP only, args 1 & 2
example.text: the $ 3.4 billion bid for Columbia

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: Will he make a bid for the Presidency in 2008?

example.name: Arg 0 in "from" PP
example.text: We thought the bid from the second landscaping firm was too high.

roleset.note:
BID-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bid' based on first handful of sentences from big corpus (from bid.01-v predicate notes)
BIDDING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry bid.01, OntoNotes grouping bidding-n sense 3; no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from bidding.01-n)
BID-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry bid.01, OntoNotes grouping bid-n senses 1, 2& 5; no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from bid.01-n)

roleset.name: some weird causative usage, not unlike "call"

example.name: secondary predication
example.text: Market participants bid the US unit lower.

example.name: same, reversed order
example.text: Investors bid up the oil market.

roleset.note: BID-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bid' based on first handful of sentences from big corpus (from bid.02-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: say, wish, convey, say, wish, convey, tell someone to do something

roles.note: No examples of listener found, invention seemed like a stretch, but you never know what's possible. (from bid.02-n)

example.name: farewell
example.text: Southern China will bid farewell to the snow tonight.

example.name: Arg 0
example.text: The courtesans did the Sultan's bid.

example.name: Args 0, 1
example.text: The children ignored my bid to sit down and be quiet.
example.arg: to sit down and be quiet

example.name: Arg 0 only
example.text: Computers do his bidding

example.name: All arguments
example.text: The chiefs sit around in silent dignity, the speaker alone rising to present their cause to the presiding officer upon his bidding them to unfold their grievances.

roleset.note:
BID-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bid' based on first handful of sentences from big corpus (from bid.03-v predicate notes)
BID-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry bid.03, OntoNotes grouping bid-n sense 3; no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from bid.02-n)

roleset.name: declaration of playing a suit in bridge

example.name: All arguments
example.text: John's bid of eight hearts wasn't enough to win.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: Mary thought John's bidding of six contracts was too aggressive.

roleset.note: BID-N NOTES: Roleset based on OntoNotes grouping bid-n sense 4, no corresponding PropBank verb entry, no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from bid.03-n)

roleset.name: obey, follow the rules
roleset.note: BIDDING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry bid.03, OntoNotes grouping bidding-n sense 1; no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from bidding.02-n)

example.name: Arg 0 only
example.text: Computers do his bidding

example.name: All arguments
example.text: The chiefs sit around in silent dignity, the speaker alone rising to present their cause to the presiding officer upon his bidding them to unfold their grievances.
